weka.clusterers

Class LFCluster.Ant

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.clusterers.LFCluster.Ant
  • Enclosing class:
    LFCluster

    protected class LFCluster.Ant
extends java.lang.Object
    Class of the ants running on the grid.

    Instances of this class are the ants running on the grid, picking up and dropping GridInstance objects and perform the clustering task this way.

    See Also:
    LFCluster.Grid

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  LFCluster.Ant.PositionMemory
      This is a memory for ants where they can remember positions.

      • carry

        protected LFCluster.GridInstance carry
        Load of the ant. When the ant carries a LFCluster.GridInstance object it is stored here, if the ant is not carrying anything the variable is null.
        See Also:
        LFCluster.GridInstance

      • dropMemory

        protected LFCluster.Ant.PositionMemory dropMemory
        The memory of the ant for memorizing the recent drop locations. If the ant does not have a drop memory this variable is null.

      • dropDestination

        protected LFCluster.Coordinate dropDestination
        The destination to which the ant wants to go when it carries a LFCluster.GridInstance and therefore wants to drop it somewhere. When the ant has a drop destination this variable holds a LFCluster.Coordinate object (otherwise null) and the ant must only perform moves on the grid that bring the ant closer to the destination.
        See Also:
        LFCluster.Coordinate

      • behaviorDestructiveAfterNumFreeCycles

        protected int behaviorDestructiveAfterNumFreeCycles
        After how many ant cycles carrying nothing the ant behaves destructive.
        See Also:
        LFCluster.optn_antsBehaviorDestructiveAfterNumFreeCycles

        protected int behaviorDestructiveForNextPickUps

        How many pick ups this ant made without regarding the environment of the picked up LFCluster.GridInstance objects.
        See Also:
        behaviorDestructiveForNextPickUps

        protected int callCounter
        For statistical purpose. How often this ant was called.

      • dropCounter

        protected int dropCounter
        For statistical purpose. How often this ant dropped a LFCluster.GridInstance on the grid.

      • Ant

        public Ant(int viewRange,
           int speed,
           int dropRange,
           LFCluster.Coordinate startPosition,
           int dropMemorySize,
           int behaviorDestructiveAfterNumFreeCycles,
           int behaviorDestructiveForNextPickUps)
        Constructs a new ant.
        Parameters:
        viewRange - view range of this ant
        speed - walking speed of this ant
        dropRange - range in which the ant can drop carried LFCluster.GridInstance objects
        startPosition - initial position of this ant on a grid
        dropMemorySize - size of the memory to remember recent drop locations
        behaviorDestructiveAfterNumFreeCycles - after how many ant cycles carrying nothing this ant becomes destructive
        behaviorDestructiveForNextPickUps - how many pick ups the ant behaves destructive.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        where - where the GridInstance last was dropped.

      • resetDropMemory

        protected void resetDropMemory()
        Resets the drop memory of this ant and start with a new, empty drop memory.

      • call

        public void call(int antCycle)
        Calls an ant to action.
        Parameters:
        antCycle - the current ant cycle in which the ant is called.

      • work

        protected void work()
        Start the working process of this ant.

        When the ant is called to work it can pick up or drop LFCluster.GridInstance objects from or to the grid. Which action the ant can perform depends on the load status of the ant. When the ant is called to work, it reads its load status (if it is carrying a GridInstance) and automatically determines the appropriate work action. If the ant executes the determined work action or not depends on the circumstances (e.g. local environment). Therefore it is possible that the ant does nothing during a work call.

      • walk

        protected void walk()
        Moves an ant on the grid.

        How far ants can go during one walk call depends on the individual speed of this ant. During one walk call the ant tries to execute all walk steps (the speed of the ant is measured in steps during one walk call), although it can be forced to stop walking earlier, e.g. by a grid border.

        Usually an ant goes from one grid cell to a direct neighbor of this grid cell (up, down, left, right) during one step. On which grid cell the ant wants to go next is random. If the ant has a destination it is limited to directions that can bring the ant closer to the destination cell. Once the ant reaches the destination it forgets its destination.

      • getGridInstancesInViewRange

        protected java.util.ArrayList<LFCluster.GridInstance> getGridInstancesInViewRange()
        Lists all LFCluster.GridInstance objects in the current view range.

        The GridInstance objects found depend on the size of the ants view range and the current position of this ant.

        Returns:
        an ArrayList of all found GridInstance objects in the ants view range.
        See Also:
        viewRange, position

      • getGridFreePositionsInDropRange

        protected java.util.ArrayList<LFCluster.Coordinate> getGridFreePositionsInDropRange()
        Lists all free positions on the grid in the current drop range.

        The positions that are found depend on the size of the ants drop range and the current position of this ant.

        Returns:
        an ArrayList of all found free positions in the ants drop range.
        See Also:
        dropRange, position

      • calculateFoi

        protected double calculateFoi(LFCluster.GridInstance instance)
        Calculate the local similarity for the given instance at the current position of the ant.

        If the ant is calculating the local similarity in order to determine the pick up probability and therefore does not carry a LFCluster.GridInstance, the GridInstance instance can also be from the grid and this method does not include the provided instance in the calculation of the local similarity.

        Parameters:
        instance - the GridInstance object to calculate the local similarity for
        Returns:
        the local similarity of instance as a double value
        See Also:
        position

      • doesWantToPickUp

        protected boolean doesWantToPickUp(LFCluster.GridInstance instance)
        Calculates if the ant does want to pick up the given instance.

        As this method depends on the calculation result of #calculateFoi(GridInstance), the position of the ant is relevant.

        Parameters:
        instance - the LFCluster.GridInstance for which the pick up decision should be made
        Returns:
        true, if the ant wants to pick up instance now, false if not.

      • doesWantToDrop

        protected boolean doesWantToDrop()
        Calculates if the ant does want to drop the currently carried LFCluster.GridInstance.

        As this method depends on the calculation result of #calculateFoi(GridInstance), the position of the ant is relevant.

        Returns:
        true, if the ant wants to drop the carried GridInstance here, false if the ant wants to keep on carrying the GridInstance or if it does not carry an GridInstance object.

      • pickGridInstance

        protected boolean pickGridInstance(LFCluster.Coordinate position)
        Executes the actual pick up process for an LFCluster.GridInstance on the grid.
        Parameters:
        position - the position from where the ant should pick up an GridInstance.
        Returns:
        true, if the ant successfully picked up a GridInstance at the position, false if the ant could not pick up the GridInstance for any reason.

      • dropGridInstance

        protected boolean dropGridInstance()
        Executes the actual drop down process for an LFCluster.GridInstance on the grid.
        Returns:
        true, if the ant successfully dropped the carried GridInstance at the position, false if the ant could not drop the GridInstance for any reason, including the case when the ant does not carry a GridInstance.

      • notifyActionInAntCycle

        protected void notifyActionInAntCycle(int antCycle)
        Notes the ant cycle in which the ant did something recently.
        Parameters:
        antCycle - the ant cycle in which the ant did something recently.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing this object.
        See Also:
        Object.toString()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts this ant down, so it is in a state where it no longer contributes to the clustering process on the grid and can be safely deleted for example.

        When deleting an ant that is not shut down, the LFCluster.GridInstance it may be carrying is also deleted and can not be clustered anymore.
